group_1.textRight: It seems we've been talking past each other.
I think I know what's going on...
She must think you're her granddaughter.

group_1.textLeft: What?!
That can't be...@Well, we do share the same name, but...

group_1.textRight: Surely your voices are different.

group_1.textLeft: Oh...
Now that you mention it, when I last saw her@granddaughter, people thought we sounded exactly@alike...

group_1.textRight: ...That's probably why this is happening.
Then it really does seem that this woman believes@you're her beloved granddaughter.
You both must have been extremely alike for her to@make such a mistake.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, Jeanette, may I have a word?

group_1.textRight: ...You'd like me to keep pretending to be her@granddaughter?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. You see, her real granddaughter is...

group_1.textRight: ...Right. We've been told she passed away,
and that you haven't confessed the truth yet.

group_1.textLeft: Yes. I'm sure you must have been told this already,@too, but...we've been keeping it hidden for a reason.
My mother-in-law's condition has been deteriorating@more and more with each passing day.
To tell you the truth, I don't think she's much longer@for this world...

group_1.textRight: Oh no...
If I could, I would have helped her be reunited with@her granddaughter, but...

group_1.textLeft: Yes. It's simply not possible anymore.
Ideally, my sister-in-law would be able to bring...
...Jeanette to see her grandmother one last time,@but...
Jeanette is gone.
We have to ensure the truth remains hidden.
My mother-in-law is so happy to hear her@granddaughter's voice again. I want to keep it that@way.

group_1.textRight: So what's our story? We were just running some@errands, and decided to drop by?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, that should work. Please do this for us,@I'm begging you.
I don't know if we should... The Lord warned us that@bearing false witness is a grave sin.

group_1.textRight: And yet revealing the truth would be against this@family's wishes.
Some people say you cannot die peacefully without@knowing the truth, but...
It goes back to what Qube said before:
Sometimes, ignorance is bliss.
In any case, I don't think you're capable of telling@even the smallest lie.

group_1.textLeft: That's true...

group_1.textRight: Very well. I can take care of it.
If things get too awkward, you don't have to say@anything.
It's not as though they've forbidden you from@keeping quiet, right?

group_1.textLeft: Come, you've had a long day. Let's go inside.
*Chuckle* But before you go to bed...
It would be lovely if you could share some stories@from home!
